posts.name: Kade Dressing
posts.cooked:
Hello! I was coding my robot (java), and imported my com.revrobotics. Earlier today, when I was at with my team on their computers, it worked fine. However, once I went home to work on it, it keeps saying the package “com.revrobotics” does not exist? I already have revlibs installed through the vendor dependencies, and even tried reinstalling revlibs, clearing cache, as well as starting a new project, but nothing seems to work! Do you guys have any suggestions or solutions that may solve this? It doesn’t seem to impact my build robot, nor anything else, but it just always has the red lines under any rev import, and it is really annoying.

Here is a couple screenshots. image 1349×781 91.1 KB

image 1349×781 91.1 KB

image 1349×781 91.1 KB

posts.name: Kade Dressing
posts.cooked:
I could only put one image, so here is image 2. image 401×818 38 KB

image 401×818 38 KB

image 401×818 38 KB

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked: Does it build correctly? Or does it fail to build with errors?  If successful, then it’s just VSCode’s intellisense being weird

posts.name: Kade Dressing
posts.cooked: Yeah, it builds successfully. I figured it would be something with VS code’s intellisense, but it is just really annoying, so I wanted to see if someone had a way to solve it.

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked: I don’t have a guaranteed way to fix it, but some combination of removing the vendor dependency, re adding it, doing a Gradle clean and rebuilding usually fixes that for me.

posts.name: Ada T
posts.cooked: You have tried closing it and reopening it right? just checking
If it’s on a windows machine it might be because your thing is in OneDrive. I found that if you have your robot code in OneDrive it tends to throw a lot of errors that it shouldn’t

posts.name: Kade Dressing
posts.cooked: I tried removing and re-adding it, but I didnt grade gradle clean. I’ll be sure to try that when I get home today.

posts.name: Kade Dressing
posts.cooked: Yeah, I have. I even tried restarting my computer, as well as creating a new project.

posts.name: Kade Dressing
posts.cooked: Alright. I’ll check when I get home. Thank you!

posts.name: Kade Dressing
posts.cooked: Sadly, this didn’t work. Thank you for the help, though!

posts.name: Kade Dressing
posts.cooked: Just checked, and it is not in one drive. I actually think I have one drive disabled because it kept screwing with my computer lol.
